sentence.Network_en: The administration has now endorsed the bill and can't turn back.

sentence.Network_en: His administration has earned low marks for its economic policies.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的班子在经济政策上所获评价很低。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : from Latin administratio(n-), from the verb administrare (see administer)

entry.def: Administration is the range of activities connected with organizing and supervising the way that an organization or institution functions.

example.ex: Too much time is spent on administration.
example.tran: 在管理上花费了太多时间。

entry.def: The administration of something is the process of organizing and supervising it.

example.ex: Standards in the administration of justice have degenerated...
The cost of administration is around £500.

entry.tran: （公司或机构的）管理部门，行政部门
entry.def: The administration of a company or institution is the group of people who organize and supervise it.

example.ex: ... a member of the college administration.

entry.def: You can refer to a country's government as the administration; used especially in the United States.

example.ex: O'Leary served in federal energy posts in both the Ford and Carter administrations...
example.tran: 在福特和卡特两届政府执政期间，奥利里都在联邦能源机构中任职。

example.ex: He urged the administration and Congress to come up with a credible package to reduce the budget deficit.
example.tran: 他敦促政府和国会出台一整套切实可行的方案，以缩减预算赤字。

means.word_mean: 1. a method of tending to (especially business) matters
2. the persons (or committees or departments etc.) who make up a body for the purpose of administering something;

sentences.sentence: "he claims that the present administration is corrupt"
"the governance of an association is responsible to its members"
"he quickly became recognized as a member of the establishment"
"things were quiet during the Eisenhower administration"

stems_affixes.word_buile: administer[[v.施行,实施;掌管,料理……的事务;给予]]男→adj.管理的,行政的
minister部长+y表名词,加在形容词或r结尾的单词后→ministry部门

stems_affixes.value_cn: 管理, 经营, 行政部门

mini小+ster人→小人→古代大臣称呼自己"小人"→部长,大臣

使减少到最少,使降到最低

di分开+mini小+ish表动词→变小,减少

Sentence.sentence: The author is afraid that the Obama administration will end up micromanaging America's economy.
She thinks that she may have to contact the Occupational Safety and Health Administration and asked that government agency to inspect the department.
Didn't I see you going into the administration building this afternoon?
The woman wants to get a degree in administration
A stated goal of the Obama administration is to restore a big chunk of this employment, along with the multitude of skills that many of the jobs required.

sentences.en: The administration of the law is very important.
sentences.cn: 法律的执行是很重要的。

sentences.en: Who is in charge of the administration of your company?
